alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Craig; Creek; Delaware; Mayes; McIntosh; Muskogee; Nowata; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 02 at 10:04AM CST until February 04 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...A mixture of freezing rain, sleet and snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with local amounts up to 10 inches with heaviest snow totals along and north of Interstate 44. Snow and sleet accumulation of 2 to 5 inches south of Interstate 44 through far northwest Arkansas. Ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch with locally higher amounts up to two tenths of an inch possible across far northwest Arkansas. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Oklahoma and far northwest Arkansas. * WHEN...Through midnight CST Thursday night. Heaviest winter weather will occur tonight into Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Expect travel conditions to become hazardous. Localized power outages should also be anticipated as winds increase and interact with any ice coated power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerous wind chill values will also develop tonight with values of zero to minus 10 degrees likely. Dangerous wind chills will persist into Friday morning with wind chills largely between 0 and minus 5 degrees within the warned area.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245- 1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
